title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.2: EDUCATION ACCESS, RETENTION& QUALITY

description.narrative: By 2024, Children and adolescent girls and boys access and continue to use formal and non-formal learning institutions., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more children (5â€“17 years), especially adolescent girls, acquire competencies through access to quality and inclusive learning.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, Children and adolescent girls and boys access and continue to use formal and non-formal learning institutions.

description.narrative: The first two months of 2021 were marked by COVID-19 related school closures. Strong advocacy from UNICEF and partners resulted in the government reopening schools on 22 February 2021. To facilitate the safe reopening of schools, UNICEF supported a total of 7,500 schools across the country (representing 14,4% of public schools) to put in place the minimal hygiene norms for COVID-19 prevention and 1,945,150 children (933,672 girls) received WASH kits. In 2021 a total of 873,595 children (413,326 girls) aged 5 to 17 years participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programs.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
